techmeme.title: In the final hearing on remedies after Epic's antitrust win, the judge says he'll "tear the barriers down" on Google's app store but won't "micromanage" Google (Sean Hollister/The Verge)
CFIUS fines T-Mobile a record $60M for allegedly failing to prevent and report unauthorized access to sensitive data after its Sprint merger in 2020 (Reuters)
A look at Germany-based Black Forest Labs, which recently emerged from stealth with a $31M seed led by a16z and whose FLUX.1 model powers Grok's image generator (Maxwell Zeff/TechCrunch)
Google says Iran-backed hacking group APT42 has targeted both Trump and Biden campaigns, as well as Israeli military, government, and diplomatic organizations (Andy Greenberg/Wired)
Anthropic says prompt caching, which enables developers to cache frequently used context between API calls, is now available in public beta on its API (Emilia David/VentureBeat)
